Settle.definition: to resolve conclusively [ a question of law] 2

1.definition: to conclude a lawsuit by entering into an agreement [the plaintiff chose to out of court]

2.definition: to make a settlement of a transfer of funds

3.definition: to adjust differences or accounts [with his creditors]

4.definition: to resolve a disagreement about (a court order) [no hearing to consider these objections and to the order had been conducted ", 314 N.W.2d 597 (1981)"]

5 a.definition: to fix (a price) by mutual agreement

sub_terms.b: to conclude (a lawsuit) by entering into an agreement negotiated by the parties usually out of court
sub_terms.c: to close (as an account) by paymentto close by compromise and payment of less than the full amount claimed or due
